entry.title: Improve handling of the devicechange event
entry.content:
Now the event is fired on a Web page only when the result of

enumerateDevices() would change.



This CL contains:

* Changes to MediaDevices in Blink, so that the devicechange event is

fired only when the page-visible enumeration results change (ignoring

group ID changes).



* A fix for TranslateMediaDeviceInfoArray() which is used to send the

updated enumeration results from the browser to the renderer when a

device change notification occurs.



* A new test for functions in media_devices_util.h, which contains

utilities used to generate device enumerations, including the patched

TranslateMediaDeviceInfoArray().



Bug: 1462957

entry.title: Support removing media-device salts with Clear-Site-Data cookies
entry.content:
This CL removes DATA_TYPE_MEDIA_DEVICE_SALTS and moves salt

deletion to be part of cookie deletion and not DOM Storage deletion.



The reason is that media-device salts are more like cookies than

DOM Storage. The main reason salts were treated as DOM storage was

UI integration for per-site removal, but this is no longer necessary

thanks to the integration of salts with BrowsingDataModel.



This CL also adds a test to verify that the "Clear-Site-Data: cookies"

header resets device IDs for that site.

entry.title: WebNN: Decouple adapter from command recorder.
entry.content:
This change makes our DML backend object model 1:1 with DML. There was indirection because relationships mismatched. DML adapters have no direct relationship with queues and command recording isn't dependent on the DML adapter.



* Moves device-specific methods off of the adapter.

* Passes {queue, device} directly instead of adapter indirection.

* Makes Queue ref-counted to ensure the recorder outlives it.

entry.title: Fix AuthFactorConfig::IsConfigured(kPin)
entry.content:
The function did not consider legacy pref-based PINs. The

PinFactorEditor::RemovePin call had a similar problem: The function is

supposed to be no-op if no PIN is configured, so it returns immediately

when no PIN is configured. However, it didn't consider pref-based PINs,

so the function would not remove a pref-based PIN.



The fix is tested by changes to OSSettingsPinSetupTest cases:



- All tests are now run for both pref-based and cryptohome backed PINs.

Previously, it used to test crypthome PINs only.

- The SetRemove test now also checks that removing PINs has the desired

effect. This check was previously commented out because the UI reports

the PIN as being removed before the removal procedure finishes, so the

check would sometimes be executed before the removal finished. We're

using RunLoop::RunUntilIdle now, which will hopefully reduce flakiness

to negligible probability.



Change-Id: I21aa83fd1663d0439f51b49c00e637e807ec384c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4701544

entry.title: Printing: Add debug code for a DispatchBeforePrintEvent() failure
entry.content:
When DispatchBeforePrintEvent() fails its DCHECK(), it is because some

previous caller to DispatchBeforePrintEvent() forgot to call

DispatchAfterPrintEvent(). To figure out who that was, record the line

numbers of all the callers into a queue. Then write the data in the

queue into a crash key. When the DCHECK() crash happens, the crash

report will contain a list of the most recent callers.



Since the crash reports of interest are only available when DCHECK() is

enabled, make the recording code conditional based on DCHECK_IS_ON().



Bug: 1459437

Change-Id: Ic6d4c10a0d14030076e3aecd7f562f4ef6e9f4dc

entry.title: [iOS] remove `cancelAction` from `AlertCoordinator`
entry.content:
This property name was misleading.

It seems like it’s related to the ’cancel’ button. That it should be

executed when the alert is cancelled, e.g. when tapping outside of the

alert dismiss it.

Instead, it was only executed in `executeCancelHandler`. Which itself

was used a single time, in a place where noInteractionAction would

perfectly fit the role.

In the `ErrorCoordinator`, `cancelAction` was set, and never used. I

assume it was not the original goal of the author, and given the

function description, I expect that `noInteractionAction` should have

been set instead.



This CL also documents how tapping outside the view interacts with the

coordinator.

entry.title: Make CrRadioGroup recognize also nested selectables
entry.content:
Before this commit CrRadioGroup used to consider direct children

selectable elements. This proved unpractible in situations where the

individual selectable elements must be placed next to other controls.



As motivation for this change, consider this CrRadioGroup on the

chromeos settings page:



https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/resources/ash/settings/os_people_page/lock_screen_subpage.html;l=69-107;drc=d6ae355e1e575596627fac7ded6c562f75a17f91



This CrRadioGroup contains several rows, each with a selectable

CrRadioButton, with some rows containing also other controls.

The natural way to achieve this layout would be `display: block` or

`display: flex` with `flex-direction: column`. However, this would mean

that in rows with multiple controls, the CrRadioButton in that row would

be the direct child of a row element and not the CrRadioGroup, so

CrRadioGroup would not recognize it.



To work around this limitation, the code above lays out the CrRadioGroup

as



```

display: flex;

flex-direction: row; /* This is the default */

flex-wrap: wrap;

```



and styles child elements in such a way that the width of children that

are supposed to be make up one row adds up to the width of the

CrRadioGroup. This solution is difficult to understand and brittle, and

this commit should help us to use a natural column layout in the future.



Change-Id: Ie5ec409183e31522ad1d9e1f4530c9bbfed24565

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4687054

Commit-Queue: Martin Bidlingmaier

Reviewed-by: John Lee

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1173578}

entry.title: [ios] Remove unnecessary __block annotation in ChromeWebClient
entry.content:
The block `blocking_page_callback` stores its parameter to `error_html`

and then call `error_html_callback` with it. Since `error_html` is not

used anywhere else, this copy can be removed. Once this is done, it is

easy to see that `blocking_page_callback` can be set to be equal to

`error_html_callback`.



Once removing the block used to define `blocking_page_callback`, there

is no need to copy `callback` anymore, and there is no need for any of

the two __block annotations.

If you --skip-for-gnrt then you get ~all the sources, including

vendoring of dependencies.



If you --skip-checkout then you don't download sources, including

vendoring of dependencies.



This allows the linux tarball building steps to not overlap, one

entry.title: Refactor startup_metric_utils with process-specific classes and perms
entry.content:
This moves the global static code to classes (needed to deal with

diffing timestamps between globals in different files), which, on

Get() [for browser specific metrics] checks you're on a browser. Then,

adding gpu/startup_metric_utils.{h,cc} with similar checks will be

doable.



The building of browser/common metric utils is then split meaning that

there is a distinction DEPS-wise between metric utils.



Calling startup_metric_utils code then is done through a singleton

accessed via `Get{Browser,Common}()` functions into which is built

dynamic checking that the code is being called from the proper

processes.

entry.title: Reduce frequency of refeching submissions for some course work
entry.content:
Adds preliminary heuristic to determine whether to refetch student

submissions for course work based on its due date and last update time.

The course work submissions state is refreshed more frequently if closer

its due date, or last update time is to the current time.



The most significant change in tests is updating how current time is

mocked.

test clock they control, and pass it to the classroom client impl as a

clock to be used to get the current time.

entry.title: Fix outdated code in cross-BCG history navigations.
entry.content:
ShouldSwapBrowsingInstancesForNavigation() is responsible for deciding

whether a browsing context group swap should happen for the given

navigation. It returns a "swap decision" that is used to pick a

SiteInstance and by any other part of the code that is interested in

knowing if a browsing context group swap happened.



The code deciding on what browsing context group swap to use for

history navigations pre-dates the use of that value in other parts of

the code, and is now incorrect. Fixing it also uncovered another issue

that forced the reuse of an inappropriate BrowsingInstance, in

ConvertToSiteInstance().



BUG=1221127

entry.title: Fix cros PinFactorEditor observer logic
entry.content:
After a mutating UserDataAuth call, all auth factor editor classes must



1. reload the auth factor configuration via UserDataAuth, and

2. notify observers about the change.



In case of PinFactorEditor::{Set,Remove}Pin, we used to only do 2 but

not 1:

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chromeos/ash/services/auth_factor_config/pin_factor_editor.cc;l=74-82;drc=d6ae355e1e575596627fac7ded6c562f75a17f91



This commit fixes this by moving the logic for 1 in the

NotifyFactorObservers method, which used to be responsible for only 2.

entry.title: arc: disk_quota: Migrate GetCurrentSpaceFor*id calls to Spaced
entry.content:
Currently, methods of ArcDiskQuotaBridge merely wraps the corresponding

D-Bus methods of ArcQuota, which is a subcomponent of cryptohome that

handles ARC-specific quota operations.

As a part of the effort to migrate these quota operations from

cryptohome to spaced, this CL replaces the calls to the following

ArcQuota method in ArcDiskQuotaBridge with the new ones in spaced added

in CL:4607960:

- GetCurrentSpaceForUid

- GetCurrentSpaceForGid

- GetCurrentSpaceForProjectId

... and also adds the ARC-specific ID validations and UID/GID shift to

the caller (ArcDiskQuotaBridge) side.

This CL also adds relevant unit tests for ArcDiskQuotaBridge.



BUG=b:229122701

TEST=ash_components_unittests --gtest_filter="ArcDiskQuotaBridgeTest.*"

TEST=See CL:4607960.



Change-Id: I94cb362724cd2eaa2c0101cf8a1016fafb9b0177

entry.title: Avoid dubious lifetime issue in OnChangePasswordFlowCompleted().
entry.content:
FlowView says:

// Reference to the underlying |Value::Dict|, which must outlive the

// |FlowView|.



The code `FlowView view(&flows[i].GetDict());` followed by

`flows.erase(flows.begin() + i);` violates this while `view` is still

in scope.



This will trip a dangling ptr warning under use_asan_unowend_ptr=true

for the brief interval where the raw_ptr dangles before the return.



Bug: 1401495

Change-Id: If47ac855d8642d1b4c89bad4bb856304cbf2a3d2

entry.title: Update memory metrics immediately on loaded idle
entry.content:
Currently the first metrics request happens after 2 minutes. We

are rolling out a feature to show memory usage in hovercards and it

is confusing to have the memory missing for the first 2 minutes of

a page load.



This change will be behind a FeatureParam associated with the memory

usage in hovercards experiment. On kLoadedIdle we will

request metrics. This might still result in a slight delay before we

have metrics but the data will be higher quality than if we request it

immediately.



Cherry-picked from https://crrev.com/c/4656209.

Original author: Alison Gale



Bug: 1459009

entry.title: [CodeHealth] Fix dangling ptr AddressRewriter
entry.content:
AddressRewriter stores a pointer to cached impl. This impl lifetime is

controlled by Cache object, that used to be base::Singleton.

AddressRewriter itself is also stored in cache (RewriterCache), but its

cache is a singleton implemented via base::NoDestructor. This means,

that on process shutdown impl is destroyed, while AddressRewriter kept

alive, leading to impl pointer being dangling.



This CL updates Cache implementation to use base::NoDestructor; this

seems reasonable given that base::Singleton is discouraged. After this

change neither AddressRewriter nor impl are destroyed and the pointer

shouldn't be dangling anymore.



Fixed: 1462052

Change-Id: I35f5ee5580fd07dd1b5c43bb7e324baab2c66c94

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4700973

entry.title: [Payments] Show payment handler window in the task manager.
entry.content:
Before this patch, when the Payment Handler window was showing a payment

app, this window was not visible on Chrome's Task Manager.



This patch tags the Web Contents of the Payment Handler window as a

"Tab". The new behavior is guarded behind the default-enabled

"PaymentHandlerWindowInTaskManager" that can be used to turn off the

feature. Both "PaymentHandlerWindowInTaskManager" and its adjacent

"PaymentHandlerMinimalHeaderUX" features are made available only on

desktop platforms via #ifdef.



After this patch, when the Payment Handler window is showing a payment

app, the window is visible in Chrome's Task Manager as a "Tab".



Bug: 1466584

Users can subscribe to price drop notifications for shopping

URLs. This CL adds user action metrics which record the user

interaction with the notification. That is tapped on the

'Untrack product'. It also records the notification itself

being received.

entry.title: Compute BrowsingContextGroupSwap for BFCache activation.
entry.content:
NavigationRequest::browsing_context_group_swap_ is normally set during

the SiteInstance selection process. In the case of a BFCache restore,

this was not set because we do not go through SiteInstance selection.



A consequence is that we do not propagate BrowsingInstance tokens and

CoopRelatedGroup tokens after the page activation, leaving Pages with

potentially incorrect BrowsingContextGroup information.



This was not detected by tests, because it requires that the first

navigation happens in another BrowsingContextGroup in another

CoopRelated group, proactively or otherwise. We were testing a variant

that was in the same CoopRelatedGroup, which causes BFCache to not be

used.



This also addresses another issue where we did not properly set the

browsing_context_group_swap_ property when doing a normal history

navigation in the same CoopRelatedGroup in another browsing context

group.



Bug: 1456277

Change-Id: Icdf2c8c1ac0f829dfb7aaa3773a2243241c4c82a

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4641932

Reviewed-by: Alex Moshchuk

Commit-Queue: Arthur Hemery

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1173496}

entry.title: Add a chrome path to homedir mountpoint
entry.content:

determine location of mounted user home directory, and the usage of

consider cookies invalid based on other attributes, namely:

* Missing `Secure`

* Use of `SameSite=Strict`



We can also remove the relevant ExclusionReasons and WarningReasons.

entry.title: [iOS] dismissMarkConfirmationSheet stopped
entry.content:
According to ChromeCoordinator invariant, all coordinators should be

stopped before being deallocated. This CL ensures that whatever the user chose, the coordinator is stopped; whether they tap a button or

dismiss by tapping outside (which call the cancel button)



In ActionSheetCoordinator, a cancel item is always added.

So adding this cancel element is not adding a new item, it’s only

ensuring it stops the coordinator

entry.title: Fix password manager os auth double invocation crash
entry.content:
This CL fixes a crash that occurs when we do a double invocation of

`PasswordsPrivateDelegateImpl::OsReauthCall` on ChromeOS. The root of

the crash is the premature destruction of the

`DeviceAuthenticatorChromeOS` which led to the extension api functions

being destroyed before responding.

entry.title: Revert "Enable URLSetPortCheckOverflow by default"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 9159e865381e8f7b99578530011a610881dd24e0.



Reason for revert: this patch is causing issues in storage/websql/open-database-set-empty-version.html, see:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Mac11%20Tests/19815/test-results?q=ExactID%3Aninja%3A%2F%2F%3Ablink_web_tests%2Fstorage%2Fwebsql%2Fopen-database-set-empty-version.html+VHash%3A7a1132327b93d186



Original change's description:

> Enable URLSetPortCheckOverflow by default

>

> This CL is part of the URL interop 2023 effort.

>

> I2S is https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/xsITedSTDnM/m/wRiJLfmzAAAJ

>

> It seems we can enable the flag without concerns since the usage is

> nearly zero [1] [2].

>

> - [1] https://uma.googleplex.com/p/chrome/timeline_v2/?sid=412c65c45018baca6cbb40a893afd345

> - [2] https://chromestatus.com/metrics/feature/timeline/popularity/4503

>

> This CL includes many rebaselines.

> https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4700004/0..3

> is a patch set prior to adding rebaselines, which might be helpful to

> understand the main change.

>

> Bug: 1416017

> Change-Id: Ieb9d3a7b46bc628a54180fbfd267154867dbf8b0

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4700004

> Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

> Reviewed-by: Koji Ishii

> Commit-Queue: Hayato Ito

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1173405}



Bug: 1416017

entry.title: [Tab Grid Dialog] Cleanup and docs around BINDING_TOKEN
entry.content:
Added the requested comments as per previous CL:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4684992



Having spent some additional time considering the INDIVIDUAL_KEYS

proposal it is likely to cause more headaches than fixes.

1) Future developers need to now know about INDIVIDUAL_KEYS and

whether any new property complies. The same could be said about

BINDING_TOKEN, although that behavior is less nuanced to grasp.

2) Very few properties can safely be INDIVIDUAL_KEYS. At present,

most properties depend on state tracked in the Mediator:

* ADD_BUTTON_CLICK_LISTENER for metrics.

* COLLAPSE_BUTTON_CONTENT_DESCRIPTION for the stored title.

* TEXT_WATCHER to track title correctly.

It is surprising this hadn't already caused issues in the past.

In fact, it is likely some of our UserActions have been

miscounted as a result of this.



Admittedly this should be safe for shared things like colors, but it is

easier to reason about if the state of the UI is self consistent with

the active model rather than potentially having stale state.



It is true that developers just have to worry about null checks.

However, if something is actually broken by setting it to null the unit

test TabGridPanelViewBinderTest#testBindingToken() should catch the

issue.



Fixed: 1464665

Change-Id: I5e139cca541b64e4670fc1b00eb0a4011f10cacb

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4706924

Commit-Queue: Calder Kitagawa

Reviewed-by: Yue Zhang

Code-Coverage: Findit

Reviewed-by: Mei Liang

entry.title: [iOS] Tab Strip UIButtonConfiguration Refactor
entry.content:
When the tab strip uses UIButtonConfiguration, tab strip currently has a

bug where dark mode and light mode highlighting doesn't align. The

proper highlighting should be the button becoming lighter/darker

respectively. Currently, with no flags enabled, pressing the tab strip

"+" in dark mode will show a darker button. The reason this is incorrect

is because this behavior doesn't align with how we set up our semantic

colors or even UIButton default behaviors.



Therefore, this CL realigns the highlighting properties to follow the

proper behaviors. You can see the differences in UI in the screenshots

below.



UI Folder:

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1YoCu_fck_3p9fdjRW37L6sP62Bx4-Gse?resourcekey=0-Ykp5mL47ljpMvLF1xmWicQ&usp=drive_link

entry.title: [Passwords] Change PasswordSenderService::SendPassword() API
entry.content:
The API currently accepts a CredentialUIEntry which puts the

responsibility of finding the corresponding PasswordForm's,

on the PasswordSenderService.



The UI layer can already translate a CredentialUIEntry into

PasswordForm since the mapping is readily available in memory.



This CL is changing the SendPassword() API to accept a

const std::vector& instead of a single

CredentialUIEntry.

entry.title: iwa: Cleaning usage of kIsolatedWebApps
entry.content:
kIsolatedWebApps should not be used as IWAs may be enabled by enterprise

policy or by the flag. By checking just kIsolatedWebApps we don't allow

to use the IWA in Managed guest session.



AreIsolatedWebAppsEnabled() should be used in the browser process or

switches::kEnableIsolatedWebAppsInRenderer in a renderer process.



Bug: b/289356220

Change-Id: Ie5397d409e3679224ac1c4fa4bd9435e0404a18b

entry.title: [ios] Remove unnecessary __block annotations
entry.content:
Marking a member field with __block is unnecessary (since the block

will always capture `this` to access the member field) so it can be

removed.



Marking a local variable with __block is unnecessary when there is

no block in the scope where the variable is accessible (since no

block can capture it) so it can be removed.



Bug: none

entry.title: [Tracing w/SDK] Fix startup session adoption for Chrome datasources
entry.content:
Tracing service fails to adopt a startup tracing session when its

config doesn't match the service config exactly. This can prevent

Chrome datasources from starting in child processes.



This CL provides a custom config comparator for Chrome datasources

that are registered via PerfettoTracedProcess::DataSourceProxy to correctly adopt sessions in this case.
